summary: The 'Restoring Temporary to TANF Act' (H.R. 2354) amends the Social Security Act to mandate that states spend at least 25% of their Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) block grant funds on core work activities. These activities include work supports, education, training, apprenticeships, short-term benefits, and case management, focusing on assisting individuals in developing responsibility plans. This amendment is scheduled to take effect on October 1, 2026.
